header: Cri. Bail Appl. No. 119/2019 (CNR No. : MHPU01­000451­2019) Laxmibai Jadhav Vs. State of Maharashtra

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1] This is a successive application by Laxmibai Narayan Jadhav for Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.442/2018 registered under Sections 302, 498­A, 324, 323, 504, 506 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Dehuroad, Pune.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of the code of criminal procedure
under sections 302, 498­a, 324, 323, 504, 506 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2] Informant Shanta Pawar is mother of deceased Monika. She alleged that, her daughter Monika married with co­accused Somnath Jadhav in the year 2017. After marriage, when Monika came to her house for delivery in the year 2017, she alleged about ill­ treatment of all accused for demand of her gold chain (mangalsutra). Then, on 12/08/2018 co­accused Somnath Jadhav dropped Monika in their house. That time, Monika complained about ill­health. Therefore, on 13/08/2018, at about 11.30 am. Informant and relatives carried Monika to Ratna hospital. On examination doctor found burn marks on stomach and leg of Monika. Monika was suffering from kidney disease. But she was not in a position to give statement therefore, Informant lodged report on 13/08/2018. Then, during course of treatment on 14/08/2018, Monika succumbed to death. As per postmortem report, cause of death is Septicemic shock following multiple burn injuries. Thereby, offence under Section 302 of Indian Penal Code came to be added in this matter.

argumentSentences.text: 2] Informant Shanta Pawar is mother of deceased Monika.
She alleged that, her daughter Monika married with co­accused Somnath Jadhav in the year 2017.
After marriage, when Monika came to her house for delivery in the year 2017, she alleged about ill­ treatment of all accused for demand of her gold chain (mangalsutra).
Then, on 12/08/2018 co­accused Somnath Jadhav dropped Monika in their house.
That time, Monika complained about ill­health.
Therefore, on 13/08/2018, at about 11.30 am.
Informant and relatives carried Monika to Ratna hospital.
On examination doctor found burn marks on stomach and leg of Monika.
Monika was suffering from kidney disease.
But she was not in a position to give statement therefore, Informant lodged report on 13/08/2018.
Then, during course of treatment on 14/08/2018, Monika succumbed to death.
As per postmortem report, cause of death is Septicemic shock following multiple burn injuries.
Thereby, offence under Section 302 of Indian Penal Code came to be added in this matter.

arguments.text: 3] Applicant submits that, her earlier application vide Cri. Bail Application No. 3992/2018 was rejected, because investigation was in progress. But, now investigation has been completed and charge­sheet has been filed. Therefore, there is change in circumstance.

argumentSentences.text: 3] Applicant submits that, her earlier application vide Cri.
Bail Application No. 3992/2018 was rejected, because investigation was in progress.
But, now investigation has been completed and charge­sheet has been filed.
Therefore, there is change in circumstance.

arguments.text: 4] She further submits that, she is old age lady suffering from many ailments. She is not going to flee away from course of justice. Uptill now she co­operated in investigation. Hence, she prays for Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail. 5] Heard Adv. R. M. Gadepatil for Applicant. Perused the FIR, Charge­sheet and Papers.

argumentSentences.text: 4] She further submits that, she is old age lady suffering from many ailments.
She is not going to flee away from course of justice.
Uptill now she co­operated in investigation.
Hence, she prays for Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail.
5] Heard Adv. R. M. Gadepatil for Applicant.
Perused the FIR, Charge­sheet and Papers.

arguments.text: 6] Now, on completion of investigation, police have filed charge­sheet in the matter. Therefore, there is change in circumstance. Allegations against Applicant are to the extent that, Applicant used to ill­treat victim Monika. But no immediate recovery is shown against Applicant. Applicant is a lady. If interim protection is not granted, the purpose of filing of main application will be frustrated. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

argumentSentences.text: 6] Now, on completion of investigation, police have filed charge­sheet in the matter.
Therefore, there is change in circumstance.
Allegations against Applicant are to the extent that, Applicant used to ill­treat victim Monika.
But no immediate recovery is shown against Applicant.
Applicant is a lady.
If interim protection is not granted, the purpose of filing of main application will be frustrated.
Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

order.text: ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending hearing and final disposal of the main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No.442/2018 ..2.. registered under Sections 302, 498­A, 324, 323, 504, 506 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Dehuroad, Pune, Applicant Laxmibai Narayan Jadhav be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) on the following conditions : [i] Applicant shall make herself available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [ii] Applicant shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. [iii] Applicant to attend Court dates regularly. 3] Issue Notice to Respondent/State, returnable on 17/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station.

processedText:
Cri. Bail Appl. No. 119/2019 (CNR No. : MHPU01­000451­2019) Laxmibai Jadhav Vs. State of Maharashtra 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1] This is a successive application by Laxmibai Narayan Jadhav for Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.442/2018 registered under Sections 302, 498­A, 324, 323, 504, 506 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Dehuroad, Pune. 
---background-ends---
2] Informant Shanta Pawar is mother of deceased Monika. She alleged that, her daughter Monika married with co­accused Somnath Jadhav in the year 2017. After marriage, when Monika came to her house for delivery in the year 2017, she alleged about ill­ treatment of all accused for demand of her gold chain (mangalsutra). Then, on 12/08/2018 co­accused Somnath Jadhav dropped Monika in their house. That time, Monika complained about ill­health. Therefore, on 13/08/2018, at about 11.30 am. Informant and relatives carried Monika to Ratna hospital. On examination doctor found burn marks on stomach and leg of Monika. Monika was suffering from kidney disease. But she was not in a position to give statement therefore, Informant lodged report on 13/08/2018. Then, during course of treatment on 14/08/2018, Monika succumbed to death. As per postmortem report, cause of death is Septicemic shock following multiple burn injuries. Thereby, offence under Section 302 of Indian Penal Code came to be added in this matter. 
---argument-ends---
3] Applicant submits that, her earlier application vide Cri. Bail Application No. 3992/2018 was rejected, because investigation was in progress. But, now investigation has been completed and charge­sheet has been filed. Therefore, there is change in circumstance. 
---argument-ends---
4] She further submits that, she is old age lady suffering from many ailments. She is not going to flee away from course of justice. Uptill now she co­operated in investigation. Hence, she prays for Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail. 5] Heard Adv. R. M. Gadepatil for Applicant. Perused the FIR, Charge­sheet and Papers. 
---argument-ends---
6] Now, on completion of investigation, police have filed charge­sheet in the matter. Therefore, there is change in circumstance. Allegations against Applicant are to the extent that, Applicant used to ill­treat victim Monika. But no immediate recovery is shown against Applicant. Applicant is a lady. If interim protection is not granted, the purpose of filing of main application will be frustrated. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending hearing and final disposal of the main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No.442/2018 ..2.. registered under Sections 302, 498­A, 324, 323, 504, 506 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Dehuroad, Pune, Applicant Laxmibai Narayan Jadhav be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) on the following conditions : [i] Applicant shall make herself available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [ii] Applicant shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. [iii] Applicant to attend Court dates regularly. 3] Issue Notice to Respondent/State, returnable on 17/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station. 
---order-ends---
